Invalid `prisma.gameRule.update()` invocation in
E:\King Dice\scripts\scrape-ultrabg-rules.js:296:29

  293 
  294 if (existingRule) {
  295   // Update existing rule
→ 296   await prisma.gameRule.update({
          where: {
            id: 120
          },
          data: {
            rulesHtml: "<div class=\"post-header post-author\"><div class=\"post-title\"><h1>Machi Koro Game Rules</h1></div></div>\n\n<div class=\"post-thumbnail\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/machi-koro.jpg\" alt=\"\"></div>\n\n\n<br>\n<h2>Components</h2>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game2.jpg\"><br>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Object of the Game</h2>\n\n<p>You are the owner of a large company.</p>\n\n<p>The goal of the game is to develop your town, so that you can build all of the major landmarks before your rivals do.</p>\n\n<p><b>Note:</b> The cards in this game depict various establishments, and are laid out on the table for play. They are never held in your hand or shuffled.</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Setup</h2>\n\n<p>Place the two starting establishments (Wheat Field and Bakery) face up, and the four Landmarks (Station, Shopping Mall, Amusement Park, Radio Tower) face-down (Under construction) in front of each player.</p>\n\n<p>This is each player's starting town. (When playing with 3 players or less, the extra cards are not used.Group each supply establishment together and lay them out on the table so they are easy to see.</p>\n\n<p>Give 3 coins to each player. Leave the extra coins on the table where they are easy to get. (Players who earn coins from the Bank will take the coins from the table). Choose the first player to play using a suitable method.</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game7.jpg\"><br>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Game Play</h2>\n\n<p>Players take turns in clockwise order. Players begin their turn by rolling the dice. The establishment which matches the dice roll activates its effect. (The player that owns the respective establishment earns income).</p>\n\n<p>End of their turn, the player can build one new establishment or complete one landmark. The player to complete all four landmarks first wins the game.</p>\n\n<p>When two dice are rolled, only the facilities that equal the sum of the rolls are valid.</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Roll Dice</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>The game progresses in turns, where each player rolls the dice.</p></li>\n\n<li><p>At the beginning, players begin their turn by rolling one die.</p></li>\n\n<li><p>If the player owns a completed \"Station\" landmark, he or she can roll two dice.</p></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>(The player can select if he or she wants to roll two dice or one).</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Earn Income</h2>\n\n<p>Players earn income based on the dice roll and the effects of the establishments that they own that match that roll. (Receive coins from the bank or from other players, depending on the effect of the establishment). There is no limit to the amount of coins you can hold. You can also exchange coins freely.</p>\n\n<p>There are four different timings for coin income, depending on what is written on the establishment card:</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game8.jpg\" class=\"floatl\">\n\n<br>\n\n<h4>Blue: Primary Industry.</h4>\n\n<p>Get income from the bank, during anyone's turn.</p>\n\n<br class=\"break\">\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game9.jpg\" class=\"floatl\">\n\n<br>\n\n<h4>Green: Shops, Factories, Markets.</h4>\n\n<p>Get income from the bank, during your turn only.</p>\n\n<br class=\"break\">\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game10.jpg\" class=\"floatl\">\n\n<br>\n\n<h4>Red: Restaurants.</h4>\n\n<p>Take coins from the person who rolled the dice.</p>\n\n<br class=\"break\">\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game11.jpg\" class=\"floatl\">\n\n<br>\n\n<h4>Purple: Major Establishment.</h4>\n\n<p>Get income from all other players, but during your turn only.</p>\n\n<br class=\"break\">\n\n<br>\n<h2>Coin Transaction Between Players</h2>\n\n<p>When income and payment happens at the same time, payment is processed first.</p>\n\n<p>If the paying player cannot afford to pay the full amount, they pay what they can and the rest is exempted. (Your coin total never reaches less than zero). The receiving player is not compensated for the lost income.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Player A rolls a \"3\". Player B owns a Cafe in his town, so Player A is charged one coin. However, Player A has no coins, so he does not have to pay anything.</li>\n<li>Afterwards, Player A receives two coins from the bank for the two Bakeries in his town.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>If multiple transactions take place from one dice roll, they are processed in counter-clockwise order.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Player A rolls a \"3\". Player B owns 3 Cafes, and Player C owns 2 Cafes.</li>\n<li>Player B charges 3 coins and Player C charges 2 coins, but Player A only has 3 coins.</li>\n<li>Payment is processed in counter-clockwise order. Player A first pays Player C two coins. He has one coin left, which he pays Player B. The two more coins Player A owes Player B is exempted.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Building New Establishments and Completing Landmarks</h2>\n\n<p>Once during his or her turn, players can build a new establishment or complete a landmark that is under construction.</p>\n\n<p>This is done by paying the coin amount written on the bottom left corner of each card to the bank.</p>\n\n<p>Only one establishment with the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/icon.jpg\"> can be built in a town (you can only build one of each <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/icon.jpg\"> establishments). Other establishments can be build multiple times in one town. (Stacking the cards vertically may be a useful way to keep track of them)</p>\n\n<p>You cannot build an establishment if the cards are sold out. When completing a landmark, turn the card face up. The landmark's effects are now active.</p>\n\n<p>The \"Shopping Mall\" effects each card. (If you have two \"Bakery\" cards then you gain 4 coins)</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/machi-koro/game.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<br class=\"break\">\n<a href=\"legacy-game-rules.php\" class=\"nextpage\">Continue Reading</a>\n\n\n\n\n<br><br>\n",
            rulesText: "Machi Koro Game Rules",
            updatedAt: new Date("2025-08-15T14:56:08.519Z"),
            ~~~~~~~~~
        ?   language?: String | StringFieldUpdateOperationsInput,
        ?   setupInstructions?: String | NullableStringFieldUpdateOperationsInput | Null,
        ?   victoryConditions?: String | NullableStringFieldUpdateOperationsInput | Null,
        ?   game?: GameUpdateOneRequiredWithoutRulesNestedInput
          }
        })

  295   // Update existing rule
→ 296   await prisma.gameRule.update({
          where: {
            id: 121
          },
          data: {
            rulesHtml: "<div class=\"post-header post-author\"><div class=\"post-title\"><h1>PARKS Game Rules</h1></div></div>\n\n<div class=\"post-thumbnail\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/parks.jpg\" alt=\"\"></div>\n\n\n<br>\n<h2>Components</h2>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/components.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n<ul>\n<li>1 Tri-fold board</li>\n<li>2 Token trays</li>\n<li>48 Park cards</li>\n<li>10 Season cards</li>\n<li>12 Year cards</li>\n<li>36 Gear cards</li>\n<li>15 Canteen cards</li>\n<li>10 Hikers</li>\n<li>5 Campfires</li>\n<li>1 Camera</li>\n<li>1 First Hiker Marker (</li>\n<li>15 Forest tokens</li>\n<li>15 Mountain tokens</li>\n<li>9 Event cards</li>\n<li>10 Trail Sites</li>\n<li>1 Trailhead and 1 Trail End</li>\n<li>30 Sunshine Tokens</li>\n<li>30 Water tokens</li>\n<li>12 Wildlife tokens</li>\n<li>28 Photos</li>\n</ul>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Object of the Game</h2>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game2.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>Players take on the roles of two Hikers as they trek across different Trails during the four Seasons of a Year.</p>\n\n<p>Each Trail represents a different Season, and as each Season passes, the Trails change and grow steadily longer.</p>\n\n<p>Each turn, players send one of their Hikers down the Trail. While on the Trail, Hikers will see beautiful Sites and perform an action when they arrive.</p>\n\n<p>When a Hiker reaches the end of the Trail, they can spend tokens they have received to visit Parks and earn points. Your goal is to have the most points from your Parks, Photos, and Personal Bonus at the end of the Year.</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Setup</h2>\n\n<h5>Board &amp; Resources</h5>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game3.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>Place the board in between all players. Place the two token trays to the left and right of the board where they are easily within reach of the players and return their lids to the box.</p>\n\n<p>Each tray holds all types of tokens and also Photos, forming the supply.</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game4.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<h5>Parks</h5>\n\n<p>Shuffle all the Park cards face down to form the Parks deck. Deal three face up into the top slots of the board and place the deck onto the Parks deck area on the top right of the board.</p>\n\n<h5>Gear</h5>\n\n<p>Shuffle all the Gear cards face down to form the Gear deck. Deal three face up into the bottom Gear slots on the board and place the deck onto the Gear deck area on the bottom right of the board.</p>\n\n<h5>Canteens</h5>\n\n<p>Shuffle the Canteen cards face down. Deal one face up to each player. This is their starting Canteen. Place the remaining Canteen deck onto its area on the top left of the board.</p>\n\n<h5>Year</h5>\n\n<p>Shuffle the Year deck. Deal two cards to each player. Players choose one of the two as their Personal Bonus for the Year and discard the other facedown.</p>\n\n<p>These cards uniquely reward a player for how well they accomplished their personal goal at the end of the game. These should re- main facedown until scored at the game's end. For your first game, just deal one to each player. Return any unused Year cards facedown to the box.</p>\n\n<h5>Seasons</h5>\n\n<p>Shuffle the Season deck. Place it onto the Season area of the board and reveal the topmost card as the first Season.</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game6.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<h5>Trail Setup</h5>\n\n<p>Begin creating the first Season's Trail below the board by placing the Trailhead Site tile on the far left. Separate the five Basic Site tiles (Forest, Mountain, Valley, Ocean, Vista) from the four Advanced Site tiles (Advanced Sites have an asterisk in the bottom right).</p>\n\n<p>If playing a 4-5 player game, add the Waterfall Site to the Basic Sites-if not, return it to the box. Next, shuffle the Advanced Site tiles and add one to the Basic Sites, forming the Trail deck.</p>\n\n<p>Place the remaining Advanced Sites facedown to the left of the Trailhead. Shuffle the Trail deck (the Basic Sites and one Advanced Site) and reveal one Site at a time directly to the right of the Trailhead.</p>\n\n<p>Place each additional Site to the right of the previously-placed Site until all are placed face up. Finally, place the Trail End to the right of the last Site. Make sure it is not on its SOLO side as denoted in the bottom right. The Trail for the first Season is now formed!</p>\n\n<h5>Player Colors</h5>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game7.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>Give each player two Hikers of the same color and place them onto the Trailhead. Give each player a Campfire matching their Hiker color and place it on the lit side in front of them.</p>\n\n<p>Give the First Hiker Marker to the player who most recently took a hike. Give the Camera to the player to the right of the First Hiker. Return any unused Hikers and Campfires to the box.</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Starting a Season</h2>\n\n<p>The four Seasons of the Year make up the four rounds of play over the course of the game. Seasons change- up gameplay each round, and the Season ends when all Hikers reach the Trail End. To begin, see how the Season will affect gameplay for the round and if any immediate action is necessary from its effect.</p>\n\n<p>Look at the Season's <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/w.jpg\"> weather pattern displayed on the bottom right of the card. Starting with the 2nd Trail Site, place the indicated tokens from the Weather Pattern onto the Trail-one per Site-from left to right. Simply repeat this pattern down the Trail and stop at the Trail End. You're ready to begin!</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game8.jpg\"><br>\n\n<br>\n\n\n<br>\n<h2>Taking Turns</h2>\n\n<p>The player with the First Hiker Marker takes the first turn of the Season. On a turn, a player selects either one of their Hikers and moves the Hiker to a Site of their choice down Trail- anywhere to the right of that Hiker's current location.</p>\n\n<p>When the Hiker lands on the new Site, the player performs the Site's action. After taking the action, the next player clockwise takes a turn. Turns continue around the table until the Season ends.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description\"><tbody><tr><td><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game9.jpg\"><br>The green player chooses to move their Hiker down<br>the Trail to the Wildlife Site, taking its corresponding action.</td></tr></tbody></table><br>\n\n<p>If another Hiker-even your own-is already occupying a Site, then it cannot be visited unless you use your Campfire.</p>\n\n<p>If a Hiker is the first to land on a Site with a token from the Weather Pattern, they take it into their supply as a bonus along with taking the Site's action</p>\n\n<blockquote>\n\n<p><b>Note:</b> You must be able to take a Site's action in order to visit it.</p>\n\n</blockquote>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Basic Trail Sites</h2>\n<ul>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Forest <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/f.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Take a Forest token into your supply.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Mountain <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/m.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Take a Mountain token into your supply.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Valley <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/v.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Take two Sunshine tokens into your supply.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Ocean <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/oo.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Take two Water tokens into your supply.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Vista <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/vista.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Draw a Canteen OR Turn in 2 tokens to take a Photo and gain the Camera.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Waterfall (4+) <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/waterfall.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Gain 1 Sunshine and 1 Water token (only in 4+ player games).</p>\n\n</li>\n</ul>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Advanced Trail Sites</h2>\n<ul>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Wildlife <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/wildlife.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Turn in any 1 token to gain a Wildlife token</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Lodge <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/lodge.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Turn in 2 tokens and gain any other 2 tokens (excluding wildlife)</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>Lookout <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/lookout.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Reserve or Visit a Park OR Buy a Gear card.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<h4>River <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/river.jpg\"></h4>\n\n<p>Spend 1 water to copy the action from another site occupied by a hiker.</p>\n\n<h3>Note: trail end is not a site</h3>\n\n</li>\n</ul>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Icon Reference</h2>\n\n<h4>Wildlife</h4>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/wildlife2.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<p>Wildlife comes in 12 different shapes and sizes, but all are simply considered wildlife. If there's any hint in the name, they're wild! They can be used in place of any other token to visit Parks or take Photos. Wildlife cannot be used in Canteens or toward buying Gear.</p>\n\n<h4>Token Symbol</h4>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ts.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<p>A brown square icon denotes that any token may be used, and the number inside specifies how many.</p>\n\n<h4>Token Limit</h4>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/limit12.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<p>Players can carry up to 12 tokens with them. If you have more than 12 at the end of your turn, you must discard down to 12.</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>Actions</h2>\n\n<h3>Canteens</h3>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game11.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>When you gain a Canteen card, place it face up in front of you on the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/gray.jpg\"> side. A Canteen can be filled with <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/o.jpg\"> on a turn to take its action.</p>\n\n<p>To fill a Canteen, place a <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/o.jpg\"> gained that turn onto the Canteen instead of into your supply and perform the Canteen's action. Note: Canteens cannot be filled with <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/o.jpg\"> that was not gained on that turn.</p>\n\n<p>You can have any number of Canteens, and any number of your Canteens can be filled on a turn if you gain multiple <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/o.jpg\">. Once a Canteen is filled, the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/o.jpg\"> remains on it until the end of the Season and cannot be used any other way.</p>\n\n<br>\n\n<h3>Photos &amp; The Camera</h3>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game12.jpg\">\n\n<p><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game13.jpg\"> Certain Year cards require a number of Photos to be taken</p>\n\n<p>To take a <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ph.jpg\"> Photo, return any two tokens of your choice to the supply when choosing the action at the Vista. Photos_are worth 1 POINT each. After taking a <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ph.jpg\"> at the Vista, gain the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ca.jpg\"> Camera from whoever currently has it.</p>\n\n<p>When you have the Camera, you're on a roll! When taking a <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ph.jpg\">, it only costs 1 token instead of 2. At the Season's end, the player with the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ca.jpg\"> may take a <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ph.jpg\"> at its reduced price. Some Gear cards give players more photo opportunities outside of the Vista, but they do not give the player the Camera.</p>\n\n<br>\n\n<h3>Campfires</h3>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game14.jpg\">\n\n<p><i>On their turn, the pink player wants to visit The Valley, but the green Hiker is already there. So, the pink player chooses to use their Campfire to share the Site and take its action.</i></p>\n\n<p>Sometimes, a Hiker is already at the Site you want to visit. To visit a Site that is occupied by another Hiker(s)-including your own-you must use your Campfire by flipping it over to the extinguished side.</p>\n\n<p>If your Campfire is extinguished, you cannot visit a Site occupied by another Hiker-including your own. A player's Campfire will relight when one of their Hikers reaches Trail End.</p>\n\n<br>\n\n\n<br>\n<h2>At the Trail End</h2>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game15.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>Trail End gives Hikers a moment to reflect on the journey.</p>\n\n<p>When a Hiker arrives here, the player immediately relights their Campfire if it is extinguished, and then chooses one of the available areas for their Hiker- placing it vertically in the farthest right available slot of that area:</p>\n\n<br>\n\n<h3>Reserve a Park</h3>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game16.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>To Reserve a Park, choose one of the three available Parks on the board or draw the card on the top of the Parks deck. Place the Park card face up horizontally in front of you-keeping it separate from your vertically-stacked visited Parks.</p>\n\n<p>If a Park was reserved from a board slot, re- veal a new Park from the Parks deck into the empty slot. When taking the Visit a Park action on a future turn, you may visit one of your reserved Parks or one of the three available on the board.</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game17.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>The first player to place their Hiker here also gains the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/t.jpg\"> First Hiker Marker as a benefit by placing their Hiker in the far right slot.</p>\n\n<p>After this, any number of other players may still Reserve Parks here, but they do not gain the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/t.jpg\">. The First Hiker Marker is worth 1 POINT at the end of the game.</p>\n\n<br>\n\n<h3>Buy Gear</h3>\n\n<p>Gear supplements your journey-giving extra benefits at Trail Sites or making it easier to visit certain Parks. To buy Gear cards, place your Hiker on the BUY GEAR area.</p>\n\n<p>Select one of the three available Gear cards on the board and turn in <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/s.jpg\"> Sunshine equal to its cost. All Gear cards have ongoing abilities, and some have an additional <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/l.jpg\"> <b>INSTANT</b> action, activated one time immediately upon purchase. Place the Gear you acquire face up in front of you and utilize their ongoing abilities to their full potential.</p>\n\n<p>In a game of 3 or fewer players, the first Hiker to BUY GEAR, places their Hiker on the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/s.jpg\"> slot without 4+ on it-this gives them a 1 Sunshine discount on their Gear purchase.</p>\n\n<p>After this, any number of other players may buy Gear, but do not receive the discount. In games with 4+ players, the slot farthest right is also available, so the first two Hikers to choose this option each receive a 1 <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/s.jpg\"> discount on their Gear card.</p>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game18.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<p>All Gear cards have ongoing abilities, but this one also has an <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/l.jpg\"> action that rewards the player with a Canteen card when purchased.</p>\n\n<br>\n\n<h3>Visit a Park</h3>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game19.jpg\" class=\"floatr\">\n\n<p>Any number of Hikers can occupy the Visit a Park area. To Visit a Park, choose one of the three available Parks on the board or one of your Reserved Parks and turn in its corresponding tokens from your area back to the supply.</p>\n\n<p>Take the Park card and place it vertically in your score area. The points denoted on the Park card will be scored at the end of the game. Parks can be stacked showing their resources and points. Whenever a Park is visited on the board, reveal a new Park from the Parks deck into the empty slot.</p>\n\n<br>\n<h2>End of a Season</h2>\n\n<p>Once a player's two Hikers reach Trail End they will no longer take turns for the Season. When only one Hiker is left on the Trail, the player must move the Hiker to Trail End and choose an action there. This marks the end of the Season, so the player with the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ca.jpg\"> may take a <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/ph.jpg\">. Start a new Season through these steps:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Empty all <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/gray.jpg\"> by returning their <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/o.jpg\"> to the supply.</p></li>\n\n<li><p>Return all Hikers to the Trailhead.</p></li>\n\n<li><p>Pick up all the Trail Sites (except for Trailhead and Trail End), and add an additional Advanced Site. Shuffle them and create the new Trail for the next Season. The Trail should now be one Site longer than the previous Season's Trail.</p></li>\n\n<li><p>Put the previous Season card on the bottom of the Season deck and reveal the new Season from the top of the Season deck. Apply the Weather Pattern to the Trail as before.</p></li>\n\n<li><p>The player with the <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/t.jpg\"> takes the first turn of the new Season.</p></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h4>Last Hiker On The Trail</h4>\n\n<img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/game20.jpg\"><br><br>\n\n<p>When only one Hiker remains on the Trail, the player must move that Hiker directly to the Trail End and choose an action there. Use this strategically to limit an- other player's time on the Trail.</p>\n\n<blockquote>\n\n<p><b>Hiking tip:</b> Using your Campfire wisely can be the difference between spending more time on the Trail and missing out on certain Sites.</p>\n\n</blockquote>\n\n<br>\n<h2>End of the Game</h2>\n\n<p>When the fourth Season ends with its Photo opportunity, the game is over. All players reveal their Year cards, and then score points from their Parks, Photos, and Personal Bonus for their Year. The <img src=\"scraped_rules/images/parks/t.jpg\"> also gives 1 Point to the player who has it.</p>\n\n<p>The <b>player with the most points at the end is the winner</b> of Parks!</p>\n\n<p>If tied, the win goes to the player who visited the most Parks. If still tied, the win is shared.</p>\n\n<br class=\"break\">\n<a href=\"solo.php\" class=\"nextpage\">Continue Reading</a>\n\n\n\n\n<br><br>\n",
            rulesText: "PARKS Game Rules",
            updatedAt: new Date("2025-08-15T14:56:38.196Z"),
            ~~~~~~~~~

        ?   victoryConditions?: String | NullableStringFieldUpdateOperationsInput | Null,
        ?   game?: GameUpdateOneRequiredWithoutRulesNestedInput
          }
        })

Just as a composer's creation is brought to life by the performing musicians, a game inventor's creation is brought to life by the players of the game.</p>\n\n<p>When the creation is inspired and the players are talented, a true work of art results.</p>\n\n<p>In creating the seven games in this book I have attempted to add a new visual dimension to the art of games. As each is played, a colorful drawing is formed. Because these drawings are reminiscent in style of the works of different modern masters of abstract art - some well known, others not so well - I have named the games in honor of the artists. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"games-of-art/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Warage Card Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/combat-commander/warage.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>Warage is a turn based strategy card game with gameplay similar to a traditional role-playing game. Each player plays a hero characterized by race and class traits, which will grant the hero specific bonuses, abilities, and skills.</p>\n\n<p>In the 1st Edition, you will find:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>4 races:</b> Humans, Elves, Orcs, Angels</li>\n<li><b>3 classes:</b> Warrior, Paladin, Mage</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n\n<p>Warage is based on the clash of two or more heroes: a hero is created by choosing 1 race and 1 class card and can be equipped with weapons, armors, helms, spells and other items and abilites using the cards available in your hero deck. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a><a>Fantasy</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Deck / Pool Building</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Spite &amp; Malice Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/combat-commander/spite-and-malice.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>110 Cards</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Be the first player to play all of the cards from your Card Stack.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Setup</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>\n\n<p>Separate the cards into 2 decks and shuffle them separately.</p>\n\n<p>One deck will have the cards with the purple borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n\n<p>The other deck will have the cards with no borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Non-Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Set the deck of Non-bordered cards aside for a minute.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Deal 8 cards from the Bordered card deck face- down to form each player's Card Stack. Each player turns the top card of his/her stack faceup, creating an \"UP\" card. â€¦</p>\n</li>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</ul></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Robot Turtles Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/combat-commander/robot-turtles.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Game Board</li>\n<li>4 Robot Turtle Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Jewel Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Bug Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Code Card Decks</li>\n<li>20 Stone Walls</li>\n<li>12 Ice Walls</li>\n<li>4 Crates</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n<p>At the Start of the Game, the Turtle Mover (grownup) should <b>read these rules out loud!</b> for the turtle masters (kids):</p>\n\n\n\n<p>\"The goal of the game is to get your Robot Turtle to the matching colored Jewel! When you land on the matching Jewel you can pick it up. Everyone who gets their Jewel wins!\"</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Game Play</h4>\n<ol>\n<li>\n\n<p>\"You are the Turtle Master. On your turn, you will decide which way you want your Turtle to turn or move. Select one of your Code Cards and place it in front of you but don't move your Turtle\". â€¦</p>\n</li>\n</ol></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Children's Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"floating-market/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Floating Market Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/combat-commander/floating-market.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>30 Coin Cards</li>\n<li>35 Fruit Cards</li>\n<li>25 Player dice</li>\n<li>15 Customer Tokens</li>\n<li>7 Boat Tiles</li>\n<li>2 Ama dice (2/3 player only)</li>\n<li>2 Board dice</li>\n<li>2 Fixed Tiles</li>\n<li>1 Fruit Stand Tile</li>\n<li>1 Game Board</li>\n<li>1 Start Player Marker</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Story</h4>\n\n<p>Ama is tired. It has been a long day of chasing her grandchildren and she needs a break. Ama has been around for a long time and she has a few tricks up her sleeve. With the promise of her famous fruit salad, Ama sends her grandchildren down to the Damnoen Saduak Floating Market to collect fruit... and to get out of her hair! â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"floating-market/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Dice</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Worker Placement</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"new-england-railways/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>New England Railways Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/combat-commander/new-england-railways.jpg\" alt=\"\" last purchased Railway Link is built.</p>\n\n<p>At the end of that turn, any remaining Bank Loans and debt service are paid off, each player adds the intrinsic value of their Railway Links (the large number printed on each Railway Link card) to their remaining cash and the player with the most money WINS the game. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a Your troops can push or rout those who would block their way across the narrow battlefield.</p>\n\n<p>Coordinate attacks with your ally to secure victory, but make sure to watch your flanks!</p>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>1 board</li>\n<li>6 white pieces</li>\n<li>6 red pieces</li>\n<li>6 blue pieces</li>\n<li>6 black pieces</li>\n<li>Rulebook</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>The object of the game is to move at least 1 of your city's pieces into your victory area, marked in your color on the opposite side of the board. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"nika/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"isaribi/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Isaribi Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/combat-commander/isaribi.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>About 300 years ago in Edo, Japan, when Tokyo was still a coastal town, and nature was greener, one could catch all kinds of fish from the neighboring waters.</p>\n\n<p>Fishermen built their livelihood on sea bream, mackerel, prawn, and clams. They went out in their boats, fished, and sold their catch. The market flourished.</p>\n\n<p>In this game players take on the roles of fishermen, trying to get rich from the wealth of the sea. Each round has a buying stage followed by a trading stage.</p>\n\n<p>The timer will signal the start of each stage, count down when there are 10 seconds left, and then signal the end of that stage. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"monopoly/speed.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"dragon-rampage/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Dragon Rampage Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/dragon-rampage.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>6 Character Mats</li>\n<li>6 Character Decks</li>\n<li>6 Sets of Hero Action Tokens</li>\n<li>50 Coins</li>\n<li>1 Game Board</li>\n<li>6 Sets of 12 Dragon Wound Cubes</li>\n<li>30 Hero Wound Tokens</li>\n<li>1 Treasure Deck</li>\n<li>7 Special Action Dice</li>\n<li>1 Movement Die</li>\n<li>Dragon Rampage Deck</li>\n<li>6 Player Movement Tokens</li>\n<li>1 First Player Token</li>\n<li>1 Re-Roll Token</li>\n\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Dragon Rampage is a game for 3 to 5 players. The goal is to score the most points by fighting against and/or running from the Dragon that you just woke.</p>\n\n<p>But beware, your fellow adventurers may hinder (or aid) you in your strategy and the final scoring of treasure cards, gold coins, and bonus points will vary depending on which of 3 ways the games end, so watch your step! â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"dragon-rampage/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Area Control</a><a>Dice</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Fantasy</a><a>Card Drafting</a><a>Game Rules</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"dragon-rampage/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Dragon Rampage Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/components.jpg\" width=\"300\" alt=\"\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>6 Character Mats</li>\n<li>6 Character Decks</li>\n<li>6 Sets of Hero Action Tokens</li>\n<li>50 Coins</li>\n<li>1 Game Board</li>\n<li>6 Sets of 12 Dragon Wound Cubes</li>\n<li>30 Hero Wound Tokens</li>\n<li>1 Treasure Deck</li>\n<li>7 Special Action Dice</li>\n<li>1 Movement Die</li>\n<li>Dragon Rampage Deck</li>\n<li>6 Player Movement Tokens</li>\n<li>1 First Player Token</li>\n<li>1 Re-Roll Token</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Dragon Rampage is a game for 3 to 5 players. The goal is to score the most points by fighting against and/or running from the Dragon that you just woke.</p>\n\n<p>But beware, your fellow adventurers may hinder (or aid) you in your strategy and the final scoring of treasure cards, gold coins, and bonus points will vary depending on which of 3 ways the games end, so watch your step! â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"dragon-rampage/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Area Control</a><a>Dice</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Fantasy</a><a>Card Drafting</a><a>Game Rules</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"games-of-art/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Games of Art Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/games-of-art.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>Games mean many things to many people; to me they are an art form of great potential beauty. Just as a composer's creation is brought to life by the performing musicians, a game inventor's creation is brought to life by the players of the game.</p>\n\n<p>When the creation is inspired and the players are talented, a true work of art results.</p>\n\n<p>In creating the seven games in this book I have attempted to add a new visual dimension to the art of games. As each is played, a colorful drawing is formed. Because these drawings are reminiscent in style of the works of different modern masters of abstract art - some well known, others not so well - I have named the games in honor of the artists. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"games-of-art/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Warage Card Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/warage.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>Warage is a turn based strategy card game with gameplay similar to a traditional role-playing game. Each player plays a hero characterized by race and class traits, which will grant the hero specific bonuses, abilities, and skills.</p>\n\n<p>In the 1st Edition, you will find:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>4 races:</b> Humans, Elves, Orcs, Angels</li>\n<li><b>3 classes:</b> Warrior, Paladin, Mage</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n\n<p>Warage is based on the clash of two or more heroes: a hero is created by choosing 1 race and 1 class card and can be equipped with weapons, armors, helms, spells and other items and abilites using the cards available in your hero deck. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a><a>Fantasy</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Deck / Pool Building</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Spite &amp; Malice Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/spite-and-malice.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>110 Cards</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Be the first player to play all of the cards from your Card Stack.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Setup</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>\n\n<p>Separate the cards into 2 decks and shuffle them separately.</p>\n\n<p>One deck will have the cards with the purple borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n\n<p>The other deck will have the cards with no borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Non-Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Set the deck of Non-bordered cards aside for a minute.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Deal 8 cards from the Bordered card deck face- down to form each player's Card Stack. Each player turns the top card of his/her stack faceup, creating an \"UP\" card. â€¦</p>\n</li>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</ul></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Robot Turtles Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/robot-turtles.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Game Board</li>\n<li>4 Robot Turtle Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Jewel Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Bug Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Code Card Decks</li>\n<li>20 Stone Walls</li>\n<li>12 Ice Walls</li>\n<li>4 Crates</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n<p>At the Start of the Game, the Turtle Mover (grownup) should <b>read these rules out loud!</b> for the turtle masters (kids):</p>\n\n\n\n<p>\"The goal of the game is to get your Robot Turtle to the matching colored Jewel! When you land on the matching Jewel you can pick it up. Everyone who gets their Jewel wins!\"</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Game Play</h4>\n<ol>\n<li>\n\n<p>\"You are the Turtle Master. On your turn, you will decide which way you want your Turtle to turn or move. Select one of your Code Cards and place it in front of you but don't move your Turtle\". â€¦</p>\n</li>\n</ol></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Children's Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"floating-market/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Floating Market Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/floating-market.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>30 Coin Cards</li>\n<li>35 Fruit Cards</li>\n<li>25 Player dice</li>\n<li>15 Customer Tokens</li>\n<li>7 Boat Tiles</li>\n<li>2 Ama dice (2/3 player only)</li>\n<li>2 Board dice</li>\n<li>2 Fixed Tiles</li>\n<li>1 Fruit Stand Tile</li>\n<li>1 Game Board</li>\n<li>1 Start Player Marker</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Story</h4>\n\n<p>Ama is tired. It has been a long day of chasing her grandchildren and she needs a break. Ama has been around for a long time and she has a few tricks up her sleeve. With the promise of her famous fruit salad, Ama sends her grandchildren down to the Damnoen Saduak Floating Market to collect fruit... and to get out of her hair! â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"new-england-railways/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>New England Railways Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/cold-war/new-england-railways.jpg\" alt=\"\" deck</li>\n<li>Game Money</li>\n<li>Bank Loans (red)</li>\n<li>1 First Player card</li>\n<li>2 Dice</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>The game ENDS when the last purchased Railway Link is built.</p>\n\n<p>At the end of that turn, any remaining Bank Loans and debt service are paid off, each player adds the intrinsic value of their Railway Links (the large number printed on each Railway Link card) to their remaining cash and the player with the most money WINS the game. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a Just as a composer's creation is brought to life by the performing musicians, a game inventor's creation is brought to life by the players of the game.</p>\n\n<p>When the creation is inspired and the players are talented, a true work of art results.</p>\n\n<p>In creating the seven games in this book I have attempted to add a new visual dimension to the art of games. As each is played, a colorful drawing is formed. Because these drawings are reminiscent in style of the works of different modern masters of abstract art - some well known, others not so well - I have named the games in honor of the artists. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"games-of-art/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Warage Card Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1830/warage.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>Warage is a turn based strategy card game with gameplay similar to a traditional role-playing game. Each player plays a hero characterized by race and class traits, which will grant the hero specific bonuses, abilities, and skills.</p>\n\n<p>In the 1st Edition, you will find:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>4 races:</b> Humans, Elves, Orcs, Angels</li>\n<li><b>3 classes:</b> Warrior, Paladin, Mage</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n\n<p>Warage is based on the clash of two or more heroes: a hero is created by choosing 1 race and 1 class card and can be equipped with weapons, armors, helms, spells and other items and abilites using the cards available in your hero deck. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a><a>Fantasy</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Deck / Pool Building</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Spite &amp; Malice Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1830/spite-and-malice.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>110 Cards</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Be the first player to play all of the cards from your Card Stack.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Setup</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>\n\n<p>Separate the cards into 2 decks and shuffle them separately.</p>\n\n<p>One deck will have the cards with the purple borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n\n<p>The other deck will have the cards with no borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Non-Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Set the deck of Non-bordered cards aside for a minute.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Deal 8 cards from the Bordered card deck face- down to form each player's Card Stack. Each player turns the top card of his/her stack faceup, creating an \"UP\" card. â€¦</p>\n</li>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</ul></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Robot Turtles Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1830/robot-turtles.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Game Board</li>\n<li>4 Robot Turtle Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Jewel Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Bug Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Code Card Decks</li>\n<li>20 Stone Walls</li>\n<li>12 Ice Walls</li>\n<li>4 Crates</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n<p>At the Start of the Game, the Turtle Mover (grownup) should <b>read these rules out loud!</b> for the turtle masters (kids):</p>\n\n\n\n<p>\"The goal of the game is to get your Robot Turtle to the matching colored Jewel! When you land on the matching Jewel you can pick it up. Everyone who gets their Jewel wins!\"</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Game Play</h4>\n<ol>\n<li>\n\n<p>\"You are the Turtle Master. On your turn, you will decide which way you want your Turtle to turn or move. Select one of your Code Cards and place it in front of you but don't move your Turtle\". â€¦</p>\n</li>\n</ol></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Children's Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"floating-market/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Floating Market Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1830/floating-market.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>30 Coin Cards</li>\n<li>35 Fruit Cards</li>\n<li>25 Player dice</li>\n<li>15 Customer Tokens</li>\n<li>7 Boat Tiles</li>\n<li>2 Ama dice (2/3 player only)</li>\n<li>2 Board dice</li>\n<li>2 Fixed Tiles</li>\n<li>1 Fruit Stand Tile</li>\n<li>1 Game Board</li>\n<li>1 Start Player Marker</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Story</h4>\n\n<p>Ama is tired. Just as a composer's creation is brought to life by the performing musicians, a game inventor's creation is brought to life by the players of the game.</p>\n\n<p>When the creation is inspired and the players are talented, a true work of art results.</p>\n\n<p>In creating the seven games in this book I have attempted to add a new visual dimension to the art of games. Each player plays a hero characterized by race and class traits, which will grant the hero specific bonuses, abilities, and skills.</p>\n\n<p>In the 1st Edition, you will find:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>4 races:</b> Humans, Elves, Orcs, Angels</li>\n<li><b>3 classes:</b> Warrior, Paladin, Mage</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n\n<p>Warage is based on the clash of two or more heroes: a hero is created by choosing 1 race and 1 class card and can be equipped with weapons, armors, helms, spells and other items and abilites using the cards available in your hero deck. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"warage/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a><a>Fantasy</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Deck / Pool Building</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Spite &amp; Malice Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/spite-and-malice.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>110 Cards</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Be the first player to play all of the cards from your Card Stack.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Setup</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>\n\n<p>Separate the cards into 2 decks and shuffle them separately.</p>\n\n<p>One deck will have the cards with the purple borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n\n<p>The other deck will have the cards with no borders, like this.</p>\n\n<table class=\"image-description \"><tbody><tr><td>Non-Bordered card</td></tr></tbody></table>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Set the deck of Non-bordered cards aside for a minute.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n\n<p>Deal 8 cards from the Bordered card deck face- down to form each player's Card Stack. Each player turns the top card of his/her stack faceup, creating an \"UP\" card. â€¦</p>\n</li>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</ul></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"spite-and-malice/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Card Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Robot Turtles Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/robot-turtles.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Game Board</li>\n<li>4 Robot Turtle Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Jewel Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Bug Tiles</li>\n<li>4 Code Card Decks</li>\n<li>20 Stone Walls</li>\n<li>12 Ice Walls</li>\n<li>4 Crates</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n<p>At the Start of the Game, the Turtle Mover (grownup) should <b>read these rules out loud!</b> for the turtle masters (kids):</p>\n\n\n\n<p>\"The goal of the game is to get your Robot Turtle to the matching colored Jewel! When you land on the matching Jewel you can pick it up. Everyone who gets their Jewel wins!\"</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Game Play</h4>\n<ol>\n<li>\n\n<p>\"You are the Turtle Master. On your turn, you will decide which way you want your Turtle to turn or move. Select one of your Code Cards and place it in front of you but don't move your Turtle\". â€¦</p>\n</li>\n</ol></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"robot-turtles/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Children's Game</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"floating-market/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Floating Market Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/floating-market.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>30 Coin Cards</li>\n<li>35 Fruit Cards</li>\n<li>25 Player dice</li>\n<li>15 Customer Tokens</li>\n<li>7 Boat Tiles</li>\n<li>2 Ama dice (2/3 player only)</li>\n<li>2 Board dice</li>\n<li>2 Fixed Tiles</li>\n<li>1 Fruit Stand Tile</li>\n<li>1 Game Board</li>\n<li>1 Start Player Marker</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Story</h4>\n\n<p>Ama is tired. It has been a long day of chasing her grandchildren and she needs a break. Ama has been around for a long time and she has a few tricks up her sleeve. With the promise of her famous fruit salad, Ama sends her grandchildren down to the Damnoen Saduak Floating Market to collect fruit... and to get out of her hair! â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"floating-market/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Dice</a><a>Dice Rolling</a><a>Worker Placement</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"new-england-railways/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>New England Railways Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/new-england-railways.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div>\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>72 Player Locomotives</li>\n<li>46 Commodity cubes</li>\n<li>1 Gameboard</li>\n<li>1 Railway Link deck</li>\n<li>1 Commodity Growth deck</li>\n<li>Game Money</li>\n<li>Bank Loans (red)</li>\n<li>1 First Player card</li>\n<li>2 Dice</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>The game ENDS when the last purchased Railway Link is built.</p>\n\n<p>At the end of that turn, any remaining Bank Loans and debt service are paid off, each player adds the intrinsic value of their Railway Links (the large number printed on each Railway Link card) to their remaining cash and the player with the most money WINS the game. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"new-england-railways/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a><a>Auction/Bidding</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"nika/game-rules.php\"><div src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/nika.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>You command a Greek city's hoplite soldiers who must force their way through enemy lines. Your troops can push or rout those who would block their way across the narrow battlefield.</p>\n\n<p>Coordinate attacks with your ally to secure victory, but make sure to watch your flanks!</p>\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n\n\n<ul>\n<li>1 board</li>\n<li>6 white pieces</li>\n<li>6 red pieces</li>\n<li>6 blue pieces</li>\n<li>6 black pieces</li>\n<li>Rulebook</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>The object of the game is to move at least 1 of your city's pieces into your victory area, marked in your color on the opposite side of the board. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"nika/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"isaribi/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Isaribi Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Game Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/isaribi.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>About 300 years ago in Edo, Japan, when Tokyo was still a coastal town, and nature was greener, one could catch all kinds of fish from the neighboring waters.</p>\n\n<p>Fishermen built their livelihood on sea bream, mackerel, prawn, and clams. They went out in their boats, fished, and sold their catch. The market flourished.</p>\n\n<p>In this game players take on the roles of fishermen, trying to get rich from the wealth of the sea. Which player will be able to sell the most fish? â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"isaribi/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"post\">\n<a href=\"shooting-star/game-rules.php\"><div class=\"post-header post-author\"><h3>Shooting Star Game Rules</h3></div>\n<div class=\"post-title-body\"><div class=\"post-thumbnail\" data-toggle=\"How to play {name} | Official Rules\"><img src=\"scraped_rules/images/1846/shooting-star.jpg\" alt=\"\" height=\"160\"></div><p>In a galaxy far, far away, ruthless Space Admirals compete to earn the respect of their commander - the Dark Invader himself - by destroying everything that comes into range: starships, meteors, planets...</p>\n\n<p>Do you have what it takes to rise up the ranks and take command of the Dark Invader's Fleet?</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h4>Components</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>49 Planet Cards</li>\n<li>45 Destruction cards</li>\n<li>15 Secret Mission Cards</li>\n<li>1 Dark Invader</li>\n<li>Instructions</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<h4>Object of the Game</h4>\n\n\n\n<p>Your goal is to score more points than the others by destroying Planets, capturing Moons, destroying your opponents' Destruction cards, and completing your own Secret Missions. â€¦</p></div></a><br class=\"break\">\n<div class=\"tags\"><a href=\"shooting-star/game-rules.php\" class=\"readmore\">Read More</a></div></div><hr>\n\n</div></div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n",
